p: Local communities still rely on medicinal plants for primary healthcare and treating common ailments. A most common use was for treating skin diseases, cuts and wounds (150 species each), cough and cold (143 species), stomach infection, and rheumatism (94 species). It was also recorded that a single species may be used for curing many ailments. Though, the majority of the plants are available in the vicinity of forests, however, select people travel to far off areas such as alpine regions to collect species like Astragalus candoleanus, Eritrichium canum, Aconitum heterophyllu, Polygonum viviparum, Picrorhiza kurroa, Fritillaria roylei, Nepeta govaniana, Gentianopsis detonsa, Saussurea gossypiphora, Saussurea graminifolia, Cortia depressa, Physochlaina praealta, and Nardostachys jatamansi.
